A total of 5,173 residential properties were sold in the region in March, marking a 27.4-per-cent increase over March 2015 and a 24-per-cent increase over February 2016, according to the Real Estate Board of Greater Vancouver.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Thu, 07 Apr 2016 14:41:59 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11804487.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Home sales hit record 5,000 in March in Vancouver area" brewers get crafty to fight loss of market share</title><description>Canada's oldest brewer Molson Coors is getting crafty in the way it makes and markets beer, launching the American craft import its toes into high-end luxury</title><description>When car-share co-op Modo started in Vancouver almost two decades ago, its utilitarian members cared so little about automotive esthetics that tacking hubcaps onto their humble grocery-getters seemed overly frivolous.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 14:21:32 Z</pubDate><enclosure Alaska Air buying Virgin America in deal worth more than $2 billion</title><description>NEW YORK &#8211; Alaska Air Group Inc. is buying Virgin America in a deal worth more than $2 billion, combining their West Coast presence and reigniting the debate over airline consolidation. Alaska Airlines will pay $57 in cash per Virgin America share. That&#8217;s a 47 per cent premium to its Friday closing price of $38.90. [&#8230;]</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 21:44:32 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11828607.jpg" type="image/jpeg" Mental-health, driven by depression and anxiety, accounts for nearly half of all health claims</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 15:49:43 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11828770.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Canada’s head bureaucrat makes mental health in the workplace a top priority" href="http://news.nationalpost.com/news/world/canadas-head-bureaucrat-makes-mental-health-in-the-workplace-a-top-priority" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11826696</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/british+columbia+tech+firm+guards+virtual+worlds+from/11826696/story.html</link><title>British Columbia tech firm guards virtual worlds from cyberbullies</title><description>As online communities come under the attack of cyberbullies, racist speech and spam, a British Columbia tech firm has developed technology to keep the trolls under the bridge.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Sun, 03 Apr 2016 19:50:05 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827123.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11827846</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/look+offshore+accounts+used+hide+wealth+avoid+taxes/11827846/story.html</link><title>A look at offshore accounts used to hide wealth, avoid taxes</title><description>TOKYO - An investigation published by an international coalition of more than 100 media outlets, based on 11.5 million records of offshore holdings, details how politicians, celebrities and other famous people use banks, law firms and offshore shell companies to hide their assets.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 20:50:03 Z</pubDate></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11828544</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/iceland+prime+minister+faces+noconfidence+vote+scandal/11828544/story.html</link><title>Iceland prime minister faces no-confidence vote in scandal</title><description>REYKJAVIK, Iceland - The political future of Iceland's prime minister is in danger after documents leaked in a media investigation linked him to an offshore company that would have represented a serious conflict of interest.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 20:30:03 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11828885.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11824155</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/commercial-real-estate/effort+attract+head+offices+vancouver/11824155/story.html</link><title>Effort to attract head offices to Vancouver starts to pay off</title><description>When people speak of Chinese investment in B.C., much of the conversation centres on Metro Vancouver&#8217;s daunting housing prices. Less visible is the corporate investment &#8212; both within the Lower Mainland and throughout the province &#8212; that has the potential to kickstart several sectors of the economy.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Sat, 02 Apr 2016 21:21:50 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11824156.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11827593</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/asian+markets+gain+after+upbeat+china+economic+data/11827593/story.html</link><title>Asian markets mostly gain on upbeat US, China economic data</title><description>SEOUL, South Korea - Asian stock markets kicked off the week mostly higher on Monday as investor sentiment was boosted by the U.S. monthly job report showing a sustained recovery in the labour market and a rebound in Chinese manufacturing activity.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 06:40:01 Z</pubDate></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11824134</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/former+financial+adviser+perpetrated+massive+investment/11824134/story.html</link><title>Former financial adviser who perpetrated massive investment fraud against hundreds of elderly clients loses his appeal</title><description>A man&#160;who perpetrated a massive financial fraud against hundreds of elderly clients has lost his appeal of findings made against him by the B.C. Securities Commission.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Fri, 01 Apr 2016 22:53:13 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11807597.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11828460</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/ontario+planning+implement+legislation+regulate+home+inspectors/11828460/story.html</link><title>Ontario planning to implement legislation to regulate home inspectors this year</title><description>TORONTO - Alyssa Hanson thought she had done her due diligence on the home inspection front.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 12:00:03 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11828512.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11828487</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/alaska+buying+virgin+america+deal+worth+more+than/11828487/story.html</link><title>Alaska Air buying Virgin America in deal worth more than $2B</title><description>NEW YORK, N.Y. - Alaska Air Group Inc. is buying Virgin America in a deal worth more than $2 billion, combining their West Coast presence and reigniting the debate over airline consolidation.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 16:40:03 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11828543.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11828459</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/buyer+beware+things+keep+mind+when+choosing+home+inspector/11828459/story.html</link><title>Buyer beware: Things to keep in mind when choosing a home inspector</title><description>TORONTO - Today, in all but two Canadian provinces, virtually anyone can call themselves a home inspector &#8212; regardless of whether or not they have completed any sort of professional training.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 10:43:26 Z</pubDate></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11828482</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/euro+jobless+rate+drops+cent+lowest+since+2011/11828482/story.html</link><title>Euro jobless rate drops to 10.3 per cent, lowest since 2011</title><description>FRANKFURT - The unemployment rate in the 19 countries that use the euro inched down to 10.3 per cent in February in another token of the currency union's modest recovery.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 16:40:04 Z</pubDate></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11828581</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/bombardier+shakes+rail+divisions+management+europe+splits/11828581/story.html</link><title>Bombardier shakes up rail division's management in Europe, splits CEE region</title><description>MONTREAL - Bombardier Transportation says the head of its Central Eastern Europe region will be leaving and his responsibilities will be split between two separate management teams.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 13:43:52 Z</pubDate></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11827847</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/california+governor+approve+highest+minimum+wage/11827847/story.html</link><title>California governor set to approve highest minimum wage</title><description>SACRAMENTO, Calif. - California's governor is setting in motion the most populous state's climb toward the nation's highest statewide minimum wage of $15 an hour to take effect by 2022.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 05:00:02 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827848.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11823896</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/bank+canada+says+mood+canadian+businesses+remains+subdued+shock+lingers/11823896/story.html</link><title>Bank of Canada says mood of Canadian businesses remains ‘subdued’ as oil shock lingers</title><description>Bank of Canada&#8217;s quarterly survey found companies plan to increase hiring and investment but only modestly</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Fri, 01 Apr 2016 19:44:25 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11823897.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11821625</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/local+business/parsnips+rescue/11821625/story.html</link><title>B.C. potato chip company finds identity in 'new and edgy' parsnips</title><description>It was only a humble parsnip, but Kirk Homenick and Pete Schouten fell into raptures. The much maligned root was just what they needed to help revive their troubled potato chip business.</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Fri, 01 Apr 2016 00:44:59 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11821628.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid Inc at 40 remains one of most sought-after brands — but are its best years behind it?</title><description>Apple turned 40, and it's a very different company from the audacious startup that Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak launched in a Silicon Valley garage in 1976</description><source>Business</source><pubDate>Fri, 01 Apr 2016 19:41:29 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11824086.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid Ltd loss smaller than expected, but revenue falls short</title><description>BlackBerry Ltd. reported an adjusted loss of 3 cents a share, smaller than analysts had
